p: Antibiotic resistance has been recognized as a major problem worldwide, and there is an urgent need to find ways of reducing the use of antibiotics and targeting them better to gain the best possible benefit with lowest risk to individuals and society. Active diagnosis of respiratory pathogens has been proposed as one potential solution to this problem. However, in our randomized controlled trial, the knowledge of the results of multiplex respiratory virus testing did not reduce antimicrobial consumption in adults in acute care. Sixty-four per cent of the participants in both the intervention and control group received antibiotics during the 30-day follow-up period and there were no differences in the antibiotic days, defined daily doses or duration of hospital care between the groups.
